mdx.excerpt: I show how to set up Redux together with TypeScript. Redux is a common library that is used with React for global state management.  I explain here, how to configure the basic Redux configuration.

frontmatter.title: Setting up a Redux Architecture with TypeScript

node.excerpt: I pick up the Redux Architecture which I developed in my last two posts and show how to obtain a typization of the Redux hooks. For this, I introduce and explain discriminated union types.

frontmatter.title: Setting up a Redux Architecture with TypeScript

node.excerpt: I continue with the App which I created in my last post. I discuss different techniques which lead to a cleaner React/Redux/TypeScript Architecture.
Continuing with the library developed in my last post, I show how to configure a testing environment, define test for the clock component and how to run and interpret those tests.

frontmatter.title: Testing a React Library with Jest and Enzyme

node.excerpt: I show how to set up a react library which I publish to Github, so I can import it into a React project as a dependency. There is a powerful tool which allows to do a boilerplate approach to build a library: create-react-library.
